text: awawa island sits in the middle of Lake
Piru in Rwanda it is an isolated rugged
place where for the past few months more
than eight hundred men and boys some as
young as 14 have been living in they are
vagrants drunks petty thieves homeless
people and street kids who have been
sent here without a trial for minor
crimes like not having an ID Rwandan
police officers call the island a
rehabilitation centre and they call the
people here social deviants they will
spend up to three years on the island
learning skills like brick lane and
motorcycle maintenance we are trying to
give skills knowledge to these kids who
have been formerly on the streets
detached from their homes now they are
here to gain skills in various fields
such that they could go home when they
are ready to be Israel during a recent
visit by a boatload of government
officials the people here performed
acrobatic feats and sang songs but in
whisper decides the residents call awawa
Island prison camp the end of phones in
economies the conditions here are
extremely crude with hundreds of men
sleeping mattress to mattress with no
malaria nets and no lights at night
because of its isolation the island like
Alcatraz is nearly impossible to escape
from many of these people have
complained that they don't have enough
food that there's nothing to do here
that they're not able to contact the
relatives and we've even met some
children as young as 14 who said they
asked to speak to their parents and the
authorities refused critics say this
island is an extreme example of the
lengths that Rwandan president Paul
Kagame will go to to keep order and
squash dissent Rwandan officers simply
say they want to stop crime before it
starts I was very minimum undergrad
arrested to be fully to become a big
packs of street kids are indeed a
problem in many African cities but not
here it's very hard finding any homeless
people on the streets of Rwanda and as
we've seen that's no accident for the
New York Times
this is Jeffrey gentlemen
